summary.para: Your first method call to start a new custom crafting tree.
Creating a new CraftTree only makes sense if you're going to use it in a new type of .

The new enum instance for your custom craft tree type.

Build up your custom crafting tree from this root node.

member.name: M:SMLHelper.V2.Handlers.CraftTreeHandler.ModdedCraftTreeTypeExists(System.String)
member.summary: Safely looks for a modded CraftTree Type from another mod in the SMLHelper CraftTreeTypeCache.
member.param: The string used to define the modded item's new techtype.
member.returns: True if the craft tree was found; Otherwise false.
member.remarks: There's no guarantee in which order SMLHelper dependent mods are loaded, so if two mods are added at the same time, it may take a second game load for both to be visible to each other.

member.name: M:SMLHelper.V2.Handlers.TechTypeHandler.TryGetModdedTechType(System.String,TechType@)
member.summary: Safely looks for a modded item from another mod in the SMLHelper TechTypeCache and outputs its value when found.
member.param: The string used to define the modded item's new techtype.
The TechType enum value of the modded. Defaults to when the item was not found.
member.returns: True if the item was found; Otherwise false.
member.remarks: There's no guarantee in which order SMLHelper dependent mods are loaded, so if two mods are added at the same time, it may take a second game load for both to be visible to each other.

member.name: M:SMLHelper.V2.Interfaces.ICraftTreeHandler.CreateCustomCraftTreeAndType(System.String,CraftTree.Type@)

summary.para: Your first method call to start a new custom crafting tree.
Creating a new CraftTree only makes sense if you're going to use it in a new type of .

member.param: The name for the new enum.
The new enum instance for your custom craft tree type.

returns.para: Returns the root node for your custom craft tree, as a new instance.
Build up your custom crafting tree from this root node.
This tree will be automatically patched into the game. No further calls into required.

member.name: M:SMLHelper.V2.Interfaces.ICraftTreeHandler.RemoveNode(CraftTree.Type,System.String[])

summary.para: Removes a node at the specified node location. Can be used to remove either tabs or craft nodes.
If a tab node is selected, all child nodes to it will also be removed.

member.param: The target craft tree to edit.

param.name: stepsToNode
param.para: The steps to the target node.
These must match the id value of the CraftNode in the crafting tree you're targeting.
This means matching the id of the crafted item or the id of the tab name.
Do not include "root" in this path.

member.name: M:SMLHelper.V2.Interfaces.ITechTypeHandler.TryGetModdedTechType(System.String,TechType@)
member.summary: Safely looks for a modded item from another mod in the SMLHelper TechTypeCache and outputs its value when found.
member.param: The string used to define the modded item's new techtype.
The TechType enum value of the modded. Defaults to when the item was not found.
member.returns: True if the item was found; Otherwise false.
member.remarks: There's no guarantee in which order SMLHelper dependent mods are loaded, so if two mods are added at the same time, it may take a second game load for both to be visible to each other.
